text:
Set in the 1990s, Captain Marvel follows Danvers, an Air Force officer, as she becomes one of the universe's most powerful heroes after earth gets involved in a galactic war between alien. The film is directed by Anna Boden and Ryan Fleck.

The movie features Brie Larson as Carol Danvers / Captain Marvel, alongside Samuel L. Jackson, Ben Mendelsohn, Djimon Hounsou, Lee Pace, Lashana Lynch, Gemma Chan, Annette Bening, Clark Gregg, and Jude Law.

Captain Marvel premiered on February 27, 2019, at the Dolby Theatre in Hollywood, California, and was released theatrically in the United States on March 8, 2019. It received mixed reviews from critics, who praised Larson's performance but found the plot to be formulaic and the pacing to be uneven. Despite this, the film was a commercial success, grossing over $1.1 billion worldwide, making it one of the highest-grossing films of 2019.

A sequel, titled The Marvels, is scheduled for release in July 2023, with Larson reprising her role as Captain Marvel.

**Movie Review:**

Captain Marvel is a visually stunning superhero film that brings a new perspective to the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU).
